snippet: Several banks and hedge funds are buying Greek bonds, betting that the nation will remain in the euro zone and that bondholders won’t take a haircut in a new debt deal.
abstract: Some ambitious European investors are buying up Greek bonds, despite impending election that has the potential to force the country to default on its debt; investors see severely-depressed bond prices as a golden opportunity, ignoring fact that earlier bond-buyers were forced to accept a 75 percent loss.
lead_paragraph: Several banks and hedge funds are buying Greek bonds, betting that the nation will remain in the euro zone and that bondholders won’t take a haircut in a new debt deal.

headline.main: A Band of Contrarians, Bullish on Greece
headline.print_headline: Contrarian Bond Buyers Are Bullish On Greece
